Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Link to 'evaluate packages' documentation" (#7712) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "Setup instructions cannot create database(s)" (#7699) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
When I clone the project and go through the setup instructions, specifically running `.\tools\Setup-DevEnvironment.ps1` I get errors on the database creation steps:

```
[BEGIN] Running Migrations
Updating Nuget Gallery database...
ERROR: Method not found: 'System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.Configuration.IndexConfiguration System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.EntityTypeConfiguration`1.HasIndex(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression`1<System.Func`2<!0,!!0>>)'.
Updating Nuget Gallery Support request database...
ERROR: Method not found: 'System.Data.Common.DbConnection System.Data.Entity.Core.Common.DbProviderServices.CloneDbConnection(System.Data.Common.DbConnection)'.
Update Complete!
[DONE] Running Migrations
```

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Clone project
2. Run `.\build`
3. Run `.\tools\Setup-DevEnvironment.ps1`
4. See error

### Expected behavior
Expect database creation to occur so that project can run successfully.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Use ef6.exe instead of migrate.exe" (#7711) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This addresses a breaking change introduced in 6.3.0 which eliminates migrate.exe and replaces it with ef6.exe.
Address https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7699
Migration details available here: https://github.com/aspnet/EntityFramework.Docs/issues/1740#issuecomment-557204757

I also removed some sad "Nuget" instances with "NuGet". You're welcome, marketing!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Figure out secret rotation story for Gallery App Service" (#7710) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Right now, secret rotation for Gallery Cloud Service relies on a fact, that it is restarted every day.
App services don't do that, need to come up with another plan.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Dropped the `DiagnosticMonitorTraceListener` usage." (#7709) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Progress on https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/1912

Removed some dead code. `DiagnosticMonitorTraceListener` needs to be configured, we don't have any configuration code in the project (or in web.config).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add Missing PushCommand Functional Tests for snupkg and FileNotFound scenarios" (#8837) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
PushCommandTests currently miss testing several features of Push involving snupkgs and FileNotFound errors. 

These tests are needed so that there is existing test code that can be modified in the soon to be resolved bug fix: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8148

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "vs/nuget/nugetaction telemetry doesn't adequately capture cancellation" (#8782) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used VS UI

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 

VS version (if appropriate): 16.4.0 preview 3.0 

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): win10 1909 build 18363.418

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: No

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Launch VS.  Open C# console app.  Manage nuget packages for project.  Use fiddler or another tool to examine VS telemetry leaving the machine.

2. select a nuget package to install
3. click install
4. at one of the various promps, choose "cancel" instead of continue
5. Look for the vs/nuget/nugetaction event

Expected: install state doesn't indicate "Success"
Actual: event suggests that packages were actually installed

When the user cancels for some reason, the event should indicate that they cancelled, and should give additional reasons on why/where they cancelled.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Test with self-issued certificate didn't set KeyCertSign nor CrlSign " (#8841) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
From [RFC 5280, section 4.2.1.3](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5280#section-4.2.1.3):
```
   If the keyUsage extension is present, then the subject public key
   MUST NOT be used to verify signatures on certificates or CRLs unless
   the corresponding keyCertSign or cRLSign bit is set.
```
But SigningTestUtility.cs will generate self-issued certificate without setting IsCA=true, so X509KeyUsageFlags.CrlSign and X509KeyUsageFlags.KeyCertSign are not set. 
(It will generate PartialChain status when chain build on such self-issued certificate.)

Events.RelatedBody: Using latest internal preview, or built from latest dev branch only. Latest public preview not affected.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Test: GetPackageCollapsesPackageVersionsForListAvailable is flaky " (#8849) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
[GetPackageCollapsesPackageVersionsForListAvailable](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/3803820961f4d61c06d07b179dab1d0439ec0d91/test/EndToEnd/tests/GetPackageTest.ps1#L40) is flaky. It has failed 10 times in the past 1 weeks.
Error message:
`Value is not null. At GetPackageTest.ps1: line 49`
Callstack:
`Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.WriteErrorException: Value is not null. At GetPackageTest.ps1: line 49`

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Logic in RestoreTask should be refactored into a utility" (#8829) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

In order to make way for a new method of building a DependencyGraphSpec and executing a restore, the logic that does the restore in `RestoreTask` should be refactored out into a utility class to avoid code duplication.

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): Any

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): Any

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate): Any

VS version (if appropriate): Any

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Any

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: Any

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1.
2.

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "nuget pack process loses file attributes" (#8846) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet.exe

NuGet version (3.4.4.1321):

OS version win10 v1607 (14393.321):

Worked before? Not sure maybe it was always like this:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create a file with read-only attributes

2. Pack it into a nuget package using nuget pack (and a valid nuspec file)

3. Extract the file out of the nupkg 

4. Check the file attributes and see that the read-only attribute is gone

Why does the packing process lose the read-only file attribute?
